definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
abbr. for 眾議院|众议院[Zhong4 yi4 yuan4], House of Representatives

sentences.english: TAPAS BAR offers Spanish cuisine. The price is reasonable and the environment is extraordinary.
sentences.chinese: 三乐维提供西班牙菜，以价格适中和环境幽雅出众。

sentences.english: Hereby I would sincerely recommend this highly-talented student to your institution.
sentences.chinese: 在此我郑重的向贵校推荐这位才华出众的学生。

sentences.english: Is Longstaff still so handsome and distinguished?
sentences.chinese: 朗斯达夫还是那么潇洒出众吗？

sentences.english: Appreciation of your high talents and literary attainments.
sentences.chinese: 对你的出众才华和文学造诣的赏识。

sentences.english: Few men have had such transcendental capacity to stir the heart of people.
sentences.chinese: 很少人有如此超群出众的打动人心的才能。

sentences.english: He is a marvelously able author.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位才华出众的作家。

sentences.english: Warren Buffett has a reputation as a bit of a wordsmith;
sentences.chinese: 沃伦巴菲特的口才出众是出了名的。

sentences.english: He is a man of uncommon acquirements.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个才艺出众的人。

sentences.english: Tamika's superior combat skills have put her in a position of power within the military forces of Deyja.
sentences.chinese: 塔米克出众的战术技巧使她在迪雅的军队中倍受尊敬。

sentences.english: His judgment, which was almost wholly disassociated from hope, held itself aloof and soared on high.
sentences.chinese: 他的判断，几乎摆脱了希望，是高超出众的。

sentences.english: All you really need is the courage to break from the herd.
sentences.chinese: 您真正需要的所有东西就是超群出众的勇气。

sentences.english: Connectors can be used at the beginning or middle of a sentence.
sentences.chinese: 现在，相信你能用关联词写出更出众的句子了。

sentences.english: These qualities promoted the use of her brilliance.
sentences.chinese: 这些品质促使她的出众才华取得了广泛的使用。

sentences.english: Superior sound performance with two noise-canceling mics .
sentences.chinese: 出众的声音表现有两个降噪麦克风。

sentences.english: A pediatric nurse's shoes may lack the shine, but they have the spit.
sentences.chinese: 一个儿科护士的鞋会不能显得出众，但会有很多口水。

sentences.english: Youthful palate with plummy -like fruit, balanced by firm but accessible tannins.
sentences.chinese: 口感新鲜，水果味出众，单宁优良。

definition: top-notch (colloquial)/to push oneself to the front
out of the ordinary/out of the common run
out of the ordinary/unusually (good, talented etc)
